intro: Ipomopsis monticola, commonly known as the mountain ipomopsis, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from blue to purple. The plant typically grows in rocky habitats, such as cliffs and slopes, and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged oppositely along the stem, while its stems are often hairy. Ipomopsis monticola is adapted to arid environments and is often found in montane regions.
